analyzed: pa ste ; gzhan la phan par sgrub pa yin pas bla ma zhes brjod pa yin no //

original: de la 'du ba gang yod do //
analyzed: de la 'du ba gang yod do //
translated: The six verses beginning with ‚ÄúWhatever assembly there is, its end is separation‚Äù

analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni mthar 'bye ba yin te /

original: dar ba yod na ngan pa rgud pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: dar ba yod na ngan pa rgud pa'i mtha' //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu longs spyod chen po las mthar rgud pa nyid du bstan to //

original: tshe yang glog bzhin 'gyu zhing mi brtan no //
analyzed: tshe yang glog bzhin 'gyu zhing mi brtan no //

original: yang na 'di'i bsdus pa'i don gzhan ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / lus dang srog dang bral ba dang / rgud pa dang / 'jig pa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de bas na mthar rgud pas 'jigs pa med ba las rgyu gsum gyis bag yod par 'gyur te /

original: tshigs bcad 'dis go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'dis go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //

original: bag yod par bya'o zhes bstan pa la /

analyzed: de bas sbyin pa tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //

original: sbyin pa zhes bya bas ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya bas ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //

original: tshul khrims brgyan pa zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims brgyan pa zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //

original: tshul khrims las tha dad pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims las tha dad pa de yang gang zhe na /

analyzed: gnod par byed pa la lan du gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzod pa med pa'o //

original: de bas na spyir gnyi ga la sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na spyir gnyi ga la sbyar ba yin te /

analyzed: de yang ris 'dra ba las tshul khrims de khyad par du gyur pa'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //

original: mdzes shing khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mdzes shing khyad par du gyur pa yin no //

original: 'od zer can ni 'od dang ldan pa ste /üîΩchos mthun pa'i 'od dang ldan pa gzhan pa ba sangs la sogs pa'i 'od zer can 'od dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'brang ba yin zhe na /

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /

original: bdag nyid chen po des bsams pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po des bsams pa zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de ni bshad pa nyid de /

translated: The previously explained means of attraction that have the nature of generosity are included in the verse that states, ‚ÄúThey become loving like friends to each other.‚Äù

analyzed: don spyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po yang bshad pa de nyid de /

translated: The renunciate is intent on definite release.

original: gang de dag gi don rtsom pa de'i gnyen po dang rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gang de dag gi don rtsom pa de'i gnyen po dang rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The qualities that are the remedies for and are in conformity with the aims of those two are taught to be the absence of the secondary mental afflictions.

original: snyems pa ni bdag gir byed pa ste bdag go zhe na'o //
analyzed: snyems pa ni bdag gir byed pa ste bdag go zhe na'o //
translated: Conceit is self-interest.

original: des na snyems pas ni bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod par byed de /
analyzed: des na snyems pas ni bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod par byed de /
translated: Through that, one praises oneself and disparages others.

original: des na shes rab yongs su nyams pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shes rab yongs su nyams pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he will attain a complete loss of wisdom.

original: 'byor pa rnams la ser snas ni longs spyod bsags pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'byor pa rnams la ser snas ni longs spyod bsags pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Through stinginess with regard to wealth, he will attain the cause for the loss of his wealth and for the loss of his excellence.

original: nags tshal du gnas pa la chog mi shes pas ni nges par legs pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: nags tshal du gnas pa la chog mi shes pas ni nges par legs pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: Through dissatisfaction with regard to living in the forest, he will not attain definite excellence.

original: thams cad la chags pa med pa la goms pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: thams cad la chags pa med pa la goms pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: Through the practice of being without attachment to everything, he will attain nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gsum thob pa mngon par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gsum thob pa mngon par 'dod pas so //
translated: Because he desires to attain the three kinds of nirvana.

original: dro la bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i dus te /
analyzed: dro la bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i dus te /
translated: When the time for eating has arrived means the time for eating.

original: dus 'di la bza' ba bya'o zhes pa'o //üîΩbrtul zhugs kyi dus de ni brtul zhugs kyi dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus 'di la bza' ba bya'o zhes pa'o // brtul zhugs kyi dus de ni brtul zhugs kyi dus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the time for eating.üîΩThis is the time for the practice of austerities.

original: zas kyi dus la bab pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bdag cag gi kha zas kyi dus so zhes so //
analyzed: zas kyi dus la bab pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bdag cag gi kha zas kyi dus so zhes so //
translated: The time for eating has arrived means this is the time for us to eat.

original: mgron du bos so zhes bya ba ni khyed dang 'u bu cag lhan cig bza' bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: mgron du bos so zhes bya ba ni khyed dang 'u bu cag lhan cig bza' bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: We have been invited means we will eat together.

original: mig bgrad bzhin ni 'dzum pa mdzes zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi khro gnyer de'i gnyen po dga' ba'i mtshan ma nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mig bgrad bzhin ni 'dzum pa mdzes zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi khro gnyer de'i gnyen po dga' ba'i mtshan ma nyid bstan to //
translated: The line with a smiling face, eyes wide open shows the antidote to the bodily frown, namely, the mental image of joy.

original: yid 'ong rnar snyan tshig gis dga' bar byas nas ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ni tshig rtsub @181a * //
analyzed: yid 'ong rnar snyan tshig gis dga' bar byas nas ni // zhes bya ba ni tshig rtsub @181a * //
translated: Having gladdened them with pleasing, melodious speech,

original: cing khro ba'i dngos po de'i gnyen po'i tshig phun sum tshogs pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: cing khro ba'i dngos po de'i gnyen po'i tshig phun sum tshogs pa yang bstan to //
translated: This shows the antidote to the harsh, angry words, namely, the perfection of speech.

original: dga' bas tshim par gyur zhes bya ba 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par gyur pa'i dngos po de'i gnyen po yid rab tu dga' ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: dga' bas tshim par gyur zhes bya ba 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par gyur pa'i dngos po de'i gnyen po yid rab tu dga' ba yang bstan to //
translated: The line they are satisfied and delighted shows the antidote to the mental attitude, namely, the delight of the mind.

original: yid rab tu dga' nas de bzhin du zhes bya bas ni ji ltar snga ma de bzhin du de byed par bstan to //
analyzed: yid rab tu dga' nas de bzhin du zhes bya bas ni ji ltar snga ma de bzhin du de byed par bstan to //
translated: The line and then do the same shows that one should act in the same way as before.

original: sbyin par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni spyor ba 'dod pa la zhum pa med pa dang ldan pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni spyor ba 'dod pa la zhum pa med pa dang ldan pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: This verse on the wish to practice shows the absence of discouragement in the bodhisattva who wishes to practice. Why is that?

original: snying rje goms pa las skyes pas so //
analyzed: snying rje goms pa las skyes pas so //
translated: Because it arises from the cultivation of compassion.

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'grub par rig nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'grub par rig nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowing that the goal is accomplished by mere desire.

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis don grub par rig pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'grub par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis don grub par rig pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'grub par rig pa'o //
translated: That which is the knowledge that the goal is accomplished by mere desire is the knowledge that the goal is accomplished by mere desire.üîΩHaving given rise to fear and anxiety.

original: dogs pa dang 'jigs pa skyes te zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes pa'i dogs pa dang 'jigs pa gang yin pa de ni dogs pa dang 'jigs pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa dang 'jigs pa skyes te zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes pa'i dogs pa dang 'jigs pa gang yin pa de ni dogs pa dang 'jigs pa skyes pa'o //
translated: This shows that fear and anxiety are the same as fear and anxiety.

original: 'jigs pa ni bdag gi dpal 'phrog par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni bdag gi dpal 'phrog par byed pas so //
translated: Fear is the taking away of one's glory.

original: dogs pa ni ci zhig bstan nas dka' thub spyod par byad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni ci zhig bstan nas dka' thub spyod par byad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Anxiety is what is taught, such as how to practice austerities.

original: de gnyig 'i  rgyu de dri bar gnyen dang mdza' bshes zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di smos te /
analyzed: de gnyig 'i  rgyu de dri bar gnyen dang mdza' bshes zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di smos te /
translated: The cause of both of those is asked about in the verse friends and relatives.

original: 'di'i don ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i bzod pa dang / sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa mngon par spangs nas ci zhig 'dod pa'i phyir dka' thub spyod par byed ces bya ba'i dri ba'i skabs 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i bzod pa dang / sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa mngon par spangs nas ci zhig 'dod pa'i phyir dka' thub spyod par byed ces bya ba'i dri ba'i skabs 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is: having rejected the fruit of the perfection of the stores of merit and knowledge of patience and giving, both with regard to sentient and non-sentient beings, for the sake of what is desired, one practices asceticism.

original: gzhan bslu ba'i dogs pa shes na dri ba'i tshig gi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan bslu ba'i dogs pa shes na dri ba'i tshig gi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the cause of the question, knowing that there is the fear of deceiving others,

original: bde bar sbyor ba'i longs spyod ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde bar sbyor ba'i longs spyod ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di lta ste /
translated: this verse begins, ‚ÄúThe enjoyments of happiness and ease.üîΩ‚Äù

original: phyed kyis ni tshigs bcad snga ma'i phyed nyid kyi don rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyed kyis ni tshigs bcad snga ma'i phyed nyid kyi don rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The first half of the verse should be understood as the meaning of the first half of the previous verse.

original: tshigs bcad 'og ma'i phyed kyis kyang gong ma'i phyed nyid kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'og ma'i phyed kyis kyang gong ma'i phyed nyid kyi don bstan to //
translated: The second half of the verse teaches the meaning of the first half of the previous verse.

original: gang gi yon tan thos nas zhes bya ba ni gang thos nas de spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi yon tan thos nas zhes bya ba ni gang thos nas de spangs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving heard whose qualities‚Äù means having heard of whose qualities, one rejects them.

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phun sum tshogs pa tshogs kyi nang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phun sum tshogs pa tshogs kyi nang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúLike perfection‚Äù means like the perfection of the stores.

original: rgud pa zhes bya ba la longs spyod dang shes pa la sogs pa rgud pa'o //
analyzed: rgud pa zhes bya ba la longs spyod dang shes pa la sogs pa rgud pa'o //
translated: The term deterioration refers to the deterioration of wealth, knowledge, etc.

original: skye bo dka' thub can dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i skye bo dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: skye bo dka' thub can dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i skye bo dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The term in accord with the ascetic refers to the ascetic who has gone forth.

original: 'dis ni rab tu byung ba @181b rnams kyis nges par legs par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rab tu byung ba @181b rnams kyis nges par legs par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the ascetic who has gone forth accomplishes definite excellence.

original: srid pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bstan pa'i tshigs bcad gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bstan pa'i tshigs bcad gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term without attachment to the pleasures of existence refers to the fact that, by means of the verses that will be taught below, the bodhisattva is not attached to those gifts, etc.

original: slong ba nyid sdug bsngal du rig cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chags pas ni slong bar gyur la /
analyzed: slong ba nyid sdug bsngal du rig cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chags pas ni slong bar gyur la /
translated: The term knowing that the very act of begging is suffering refers to the fact that, because of attachment, one becomes a beggar.

original: slong bas ni chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slong bas ni chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of begging, one becomes attached.

original: de bas na slong ba spangs pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bas na slong ba spangs pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, the avoidance of begging is the best.

original: chog shes pa la goms pa zhes bya ba ni dka' bas rnyed pas 'tsho ba gnas pa'i sgrub pas cho ga shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog shes pa la goms pa zhes bya ba ni dka' bas rnyed pas 'tsho ba gnas pa'i sgrub pas cho ga shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one who is accustomed to contentment means one who is skilled in the rite of living by means of what is obtained with little difficulty.

original: chung ma yid du 'ong dang bu dang dbang byed dang // zhes bya ba ni sems can du bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chung ma yid du 'ong dang bu dang dbang byed dang // zhes bya ba ni sems can du bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase a beautiful wife, sons, and dominion indicates the result of the accumulation of merit that is taught in the section on sentient beings.

original: nor ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nor ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The phrase wealth indicates the result of the accumulation of the merit that arises from generosity.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba thob dka' ba nyid ces bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i sgra ni zhe sdang nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba thob dka' ba nyid ces bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i sgra ni zhe sdang nyid de /
translated: The phrase the attainment of freedom from affliction indicates the difficulty of attaining freedom from hatred.

original: ci'i phyir de bzung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzung zhe na /
translated: Why is hatred singled out?

original: chags pa la sogs pa spyir bstan pa yin yang 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi nang na tha chad yin te /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa spyir bstan pa yin yang 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi nang na tha chad yin te /
translated: Although attachment and so on are mentioned in the general sense, hatred is the worst of all the afflictions.

original: bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pas so //
translated: It is the worst because it torments both oneself and others.

original: nor yang nyams shing zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: nor yang nyams shing zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can ma yin pa las so //
translated: The phrase wealth is lost refers to the loss of external wealth that is not sentient.

original: mdog bzang zhes bya ba ni nang gi mdog rgud pa'o //
analyzed: mdog bzang zhes bya ba ni nang gi mdog rgud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGood complexion‚Äù means the inner complexion is impaired.

original: grags pa ni sems can gzhan gyi dad pa rgud pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni sems can gzhan gyi dad pa rgud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFame‚Äù means the faith of other sentient beings is impaired.

original: bde ba las kyang zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang phan 'dogs pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba las kyang zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang phan 'dogs pa nyams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHappiness‚Äù means the intention and benefit are impaired.

original: phongs par gyur la zhes bya bya ba bstan pa la phongs pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir phongs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i don no //
analyzed: phongs par gyur la zhes bya bya ba bstan pa la phongs pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir phongs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i don no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn distress‚Äù means that the distress is the basis for accomplishing that distress.

original: byis pa tha ma yin par 'dod ces bya ba ni phongs pa thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byis pa tha ma yin par 'dod ces bya ba ni phongs pa thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The worst of fools is considered the worst of all.

original: byis pa ni phongs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir khyad par du snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pa ni phongs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir khyad par du snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The worst of fools is the worst of all because he is the basis of all distress.

original: mthong ba tsam du'ang mi 'dod pa nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa dang phebs par smra ba lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam du'ang mi 'dod pa nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa dang phebs par smra ba lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: He is not even desired to be seen, let alone to live with or talk to.

original: 'di dag tshul min pa yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i dan ni @182a * //üîΩbdag la phan pa'i khyad par mi byed cing gzhan gyi kha na ma tho ba dang slu bar byed pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag tshul min pa yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i dan ni @182a * // bdag la phan pa'i khyad par mi byed cing gzhan gyi kha na ma tho ba dang slu bar byed pa yang bstan to //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThey are not the way they seem‚Äù summarizes the following:üîΩThey do not benefit themselves, they do not benefit others, they are not the way they seem, they are not the way they are proclaimed, they are not the way they are taken up, and they are not the way they are cultivated.

original: bdag nyid kyang phan pa ma yin pa dang / lugs ma yin pa sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang phan pa ma yin pa dang / lugs ma yin pa sgrub par byed la /
translated: They do not benefit themselves because they do not accomplish their own aim.

original: de la smas pa'i phyir gzhan yang rab tu sbyor bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de la smas pa'i phyir gzhan yang rab tu sbyor bar 'dod de /
translated: They do not benefit others because they do not accomplish the aims of others.üîΩThey are not the way they seem because they are not the way they are proclaimed.üîΩThey are not the way they are proclaimed because they are not the way they are taken up.

original: khyad par sgrub par mi byed pa dang phan bsgrub par mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par sgrub par mi byed pa dang phan bsgrub par mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: They are not the way they are taken up because they are not the way they are cultivated.

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni 'di dag tshul min zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni 'di dag tshul min zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThey are not the way they seem‚Äù is established by the verse ‚ÄúThe wise are conceited and confused.‚Äù

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal dang gti mug ni mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug dag go //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal dang gti mug ni mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug dag go //
translated: The wise are conceited and confused means that the wise are conceited and confused.

original: yang na mkhas pa'i nga rgyal nyid gti mug ste mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug go //
analyzed: yang na mkhas pa'i nga rgyal nyid gti mug ste mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug go //
translated: Or, the wise are conceited and confused means that the wise are conceited and confused.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin nga rgyal gyi gti mug gis bsgribs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin nga rgyal gyi gti mug gis bsgribs pa yin te /
translated: The nature of the self is obscured by the delusion of pride.

original: des tshul ma yin pa la tshul bzhin du sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: des tshul ma yin pa la tshul bzhin du sgrub par byed la /
translated: By that, one practices what is improper as if it were proper.

original: gzhan yang 'di la rab tu sbyor bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la rab tu sbyor bar 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, one wishes to apply oneself to that.üîΩHere, one is harsh due to anger even towards one who speaks beneficially.

original: 'dir phan par smra la'ang khro bas rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dag ni phan pa yin na yang phan pa ma yin bzhin du rab tu khro bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir phan par smra la'ang khro bas rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dag ni phan pa yin na yang phan pa ma yin bzhin du rab tu khro bar byed do //
translated: One is angry towards sentient beings even though they are beneficial, as if they were not beneficial.üîΩOne is in a state of disharmony with the stages of uprightness.

original: drang po'i rim pa mi mthun ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: drang po'i rim pa mi mthun ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzu lums can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzu lums can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is a braggart.üîΩOne is in a state of disharmony with the training.

original: 'dul ba dang mi mthun pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mi mthun pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dul ba la brtson 'grus chung zhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba la brtson 'grus chung zhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has little perseverance in the training.

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs shing //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs shing //
translated: One is burned by the fire of the delusion of pride of the wise.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan gyi thad du song nas phan pa'i dri ba'i tshig sgrub pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan gyi thad du song nas phan pa'i dri ba'i tshig sgrub pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because, having gone to others, one does not have the words to request beneficial advice.

original: des na de nyid kyis bdag kyang log par sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: des na de nyid kyis bdag kyang log par sgrub par byed la /
translated: Therefore, he himself is established in the right way,

original: gzhan yang de la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and he also causes others to be established in it.üîΩThe steadfast one is the bodhisattva.

original: brtan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: He is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.üîΩThe steadfast one is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.üîΩThe steadfast one is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.üîΩThe steadfast one is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.üîΩThe steadfast one is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.

original: g-yo sgyu med pa ni 'dul bas rtag tu brgyan zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i 'dul ba dang / drang po'i rim pa mi mthun pa zhes bya ba de'i gnyen po'o //üîΩphan pa'i bsam ba dang zhes bya ba ni ci nas phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu med pa ni 'dul bas rtag tu brgyan zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i 'dul ba dang / drang po'i rim pa mi mthun pa zhes bya ba de'i gnyen po'o // phan pa'i bsam ba dang zhes bya ba ni ci nas phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The steadfast one is always adorned with discipline, because he is without deceit and guile.

analyzed: yang na nor rim gyis nyung ngur gyur pa ni mdza' bo nor dang ldan pa rnams la slong ba 'phel ba mdzes pa yin te /

analyzed: de zad cing dbul por gyur pa mdza' bo dag la slong ba 'phel ba mdzes pa yin no //

original: de bas na khyad par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par bstan par 'gyur te /

analyzed: brgya la 'byor pa zad par ma gyur na yang byams shing yid gcugs par bstan pa'i phyir dbul ba la yang slong bar mi rigs so //

original: nam yang nang gi dngos po ni slong bar rigs pa med de /
analyzed: nam yang nang gi dngos po ni slong bar rigs pa med de /

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad brtsams so //

analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ma mthong zhing ma 'dris pa'o //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar byams shing yid gcugs pa'i dngos po dag la ste //

analyzed: des na khyed la yang gnod pa btang snyoms su bya zhing /

analyzed: ji ltar 'og nas brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mdun nas so //

analyzed: de ltar re zhig sbyin pa'i bya ba rigs pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the activity of generosity has been taught as being proper.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dbye bas dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dbye bas dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of the above-mentioned divisions,

original: de bas na nga la rab tu byams pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na nga la rab tu byams pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, Therefore, those who love me, etc.

original: chos kyi bgegs la 'dzem pa med pa zhes bya bas ni de dag chos ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'dzem pa bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi bgegs la 'dzem pa med pa zhes bya bas ni de dag chos ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'dzem pa bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: By the phrase, without regard for the obstruction of the Dharma, he teaches the division characterized by the production of disregard, since they are taught to be non-Dharma.

original: ji ltar dbye ba de yang chos ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar dbye ba de yang chos ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The division is taught to be non-Dharma, just as it is stated.

original: da ni log pa nyid du bstan par 'dod @191a * //
analyzed: da ni log pa nyid du bstan par 'dod @191a * //
translated: Now, he wishes to teach the perversity.

original: pas ; nga'i don du khyod ci spyod pa 'di lta bu bya ba mi rigs te zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: pas ; nga'i don du khyod ci spyod pa 'di lta bu bya ba mi rigs te zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, it is not right for you to act in this way for my sake.

original: nged cag gi don ni nga'i don te nged cag gi don du'o //
analyzed: nged cag gi don ni nga'i don te nged cag gi don du'o //
translated: For our sake means for my sake, for our sake.

original: khyed cag gis nam yang nga'i don du sbyin pa'i bgegs ni bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: khyed cag gis nam yang nga'i don du sbyin pa'i bgegs ni bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: It is not right for you to ever obstruct my giving, is the meaning.

original: bdag gi don du bza' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi yin pas bdag ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don du bza' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi yin pas bdag ste /
translated: As for food, etc. for my sake, my means my own.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the attainment of high status and certain goodness.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: External things are food, drink, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The etc. includes sentient and non-sentient things.

original: de ltar byed pa ci 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa ci 'drar 'gyur //
translated: What will happen if you act like this?

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don du nang gi sbyin pa ni sngon gang gis ma sbyin te byang chub sems dpa' dag gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don du nang gi sbyin pa ni sngon gang gis ma sbyin te byang chub sems dpa' dag gis so //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings, the internal giving that was not given before is given by the Bodhisattvas.

original: legs sam ga la te ma legs kyang //
analyzed: legs sam ga la te ma legs kyang //
translated: How could it be good? It is not good.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ji ltar legs pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩzhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar legs pa nyid ma yin no // zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is not good at all.

original: 'dis kyang chos ma yin pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid bstan te sbyin pa'i gegs so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang chos ma yin pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid bstan te sbyin pa'i gegs so //
translated: This shows that it is not Dharma and not the truth, and it is an obstacle to generosity.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po gtong ba 'gog par byed pa ste ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po gtong ba 'gog par byed pa ste ;
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the prohibition against giving inner things.

original: 'di ltar legs pa ma yin par 'gyur zhing chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar legs pa ma yin par 'gyur zhing chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is not good in this way, and it is associated with non-Dharma.

original: khyed cag nam yang de lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag nam yang de lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: You should never do such a thing.

original: nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i dgag pa gang yin pa de ni legs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i dgag pa gang yin pa de ni legs pa ma yin la /
translated: The prohibition against giving inner things is not good.

original: dgag pa ma yin pa de ni legs pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa ma yin pa de ni legs pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of prohibition is itself good.

original: khyed kyi ni srog gcod pa la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi ni srog gcod pa la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: You should rejoice in killing.

original: des na nga'i rjes su 'gro bar bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: des na nga'i rjes su 'gro bar bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, I have composed this in order to investigate with reasoning what should be followed by me.

original: nga'i grogs rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba bstan pa la /
analyzed: nga'i grogs rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba bstan pa la /
translated: The explanation of the friend who is in accord with me:

original: grogs kyi ngo bo ni gogs te bka' la gtogs te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grogs kyi ngo bo ni gogs te bka' la gtogs te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The essence of a friend is one who is a companion, who is included in the command.

original: nged cag byang chub sems dpa'i grogs de dang mthun pa ni nga'i grogs mthun pa ste /
analyzed: nged cag byang chub sems dpa'i grogs de dang mthun pa ni nga'i grogs mthun pa ste /
translated: The friend who is in accord with me, a bodhisattva, is a friend who is in accord with that.

original: 'di ni gzhan mi mthun pa'i zhes bstan pa'i tshul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan mi mthun pa'i zhes bstan pa'i tshul du 'gyur te /
translated: This is the way of teaching that others are not in accord.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lam log par 'gro ba las bzlog pa'i ste /
analyzed: lam log par 'gro ba las bzlog pa'i ste /
translated: It is the reversal of going in the wrong direction.

original: lam log pa las bzlog pa @191b yin pas log par 'gro ba de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: lam log pa las bzlog pa @191b yin pas log par 'gro ba de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Since it is the reversal of the wrong direction, it is the reversal of that going in the wrong direction.

original: de gang zhe na yid do //
analyzed: de gang zhe na yid do //
translated: What is that? It is the mind.üîΩIt should be analyzed with reasoning.

original: rigs pas dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang la la sems can rnams kyi don du bdag nyid yongs su gtong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang la la sems can rnams kyi don du bdag nyid yongs su gtong bar byed pa ste /
translated: This is for the sake of sentient beings, who give up their own bodies.

original: gzhan gang zhig rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pa de ni rjes su yi rang ba srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes 'dir yang kha cig zhugs par 'gyur zhes 'dir yang kha cig zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang zhig rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pa de ni rjes su yi rang ba srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes 'dir yang kha cig zhugs par 'gyur zhes 'dir yang kha cig zhugs pa'o //
translated: But if one does not rejoice in that, then one would have the sin of rejoicing in killing.

original: ci ste rigs sam mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ste rigs sam mi rigs she na /
translated: But whether it is right or not,

original: skyes pa'i rabs thos pas kyang bsod nams med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs thos pas kyang bsod nams med par 'gyur te /
translated: one would not have merit from hearing the Jataka stories,

original: de na ni byang chub sems dpa' nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na ni byang chub sems dpa' nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there the Bodhisattva gives away his inner parts.

original: de la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yang bsod nams ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yang bsod nams ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And one who rejoices in that would have demerit from rejoicing.

original: gal te 'das ma thag pa de ltar rigs pas dpyad par byas pa de bas na bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin ba de nyid log pa'i lam de las bzlog par byas pa de la rjes su yi rang ba dang mthun pa'i tshig gang yin pa de
analyzed: gal te 'das ma thag pa de ltar rigs pas dpyad par byas pa de bas na bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin ba de nyid log pa'i lam de las bzlog par byas pa de la rjes su yi rang ba dang mthun pa'i tshig gang yin pa de
translated: But if one examines that by the reasoning just explained, then one who rejoices in that demerit would have the words of rejoicing in the opposite of that wrong path.

original: ni rjes su yi rang ba dang mthun pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ni rjes su yi rang ba dang mthun pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word excellent is synonymous with excellent-making.

original: bzang ngo zhes bya ba nyid ni bzang ba nyid do //
analyzed: bzang ngo zhes bya ba nyid ni bzang ba nyid do //
translated: The word excellent is synonymous with excellent-making.

original: de ltar byed pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need be said about one who acts in this way?

original: de ltar bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the excellence of this activity, he says:

original: nor ni gcig pus spyad pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos so //
analyzed: nor ni gcig pus spyad pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos so //
translated: This wealth is not to be enjoyed by one alone.

original: bya ba de'i khyad par rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba de'i khyad par rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa ste /
translated: This verse shows the excellence of this activity in two ways.

original: slong ba nyid du rnyed dka' ba'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i dngos po shes pas ma rung ba yongs su gtong ba legs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slong ba nyid du rnyed dka' ba'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i dngos po shes pas ma rung ba yongs su gtong ba legs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to obtain the opportunity to practice generosity, and it is excellent to give up the unwholesome by means of the knowledge of the things that are given.

original: de las nang gi dngos po gtong ba rnyed dka' ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de las nang gi dngos po gtong ba rnyed dka' ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the difficulty of giving up internal things, he says:

original: nor ni gcig pus spyad pa ma yin la //
analyzed: nor ni gcig pus spyad pa ma yin la //
translated: This wealth is not to be enjoyed by one alone.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: This verse shows the difficulty of giving up internal things.

original: gcig pus ma yin la zhes bya ba ni nor 'di dag gcig pus spyad pa gang yin pa de ni de ste /
analyzed: gcig pus ma yin la zhes bya ba ni nor 'di dag gcig pus spyad pa gang yin pa de ni de ste /
translated: The phrase this wealth refers to the internal things.

original: nor gcig pus spyad par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nor gcig pus spyad par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúto be enjoyed by a single person.‚Äù

original: nor zhes smos pas ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos la sogs pa bye brag med par gzung ngo //
analyzed: nor zhes smos pas ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos la sogs pa bye brag med par gzung ngo //
translated: By the word ‚Äúwealth,‚Äù food, drink, clothing, etc. are meant, without distinction.üîΩ‚ÄúNot daily‚Äù means

original: nyin re ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /üîΩnyi ma re re zhing ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyin re ma yin la zhes bya ba ni / nyi ma re re zhing ma yin pa ste /
translated: not every day.

original: dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúat the wrong time.‚Äù

original: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnyed dka' ba nyid du @192a * //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnyed dka' ba nyid du @192a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will not be,‚Äù shows that it is difficult to obtain.

original: bstan to // slong ba 'di lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po longs spyod cing slong ba'i skye bo ni nyung bas so //
analyzed: bstan to // slong ba 'di lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po longs spyod cing slong ba'i skye bo ni nyung bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a petitioner‚Äù means that the people who enjoy the internal things and ask for them are few.

original: lha dag mnyes par byas kyang mi 'grub na //
analyzed: lha dag mnyes par byas kyang mi 'grub na //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the gods are propitiated, it will not be accomplished,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni shin tu rnyed dka' ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni shin tu rnyed dka' ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: this shows that it is very difficult to obtain.

original: slong ba 'di lta bus yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis ni sbyin pa'i dngos po nyes pas ma rung bar gyur pa'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa gtong ba sla ba nyid du ston par 'dod pas brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: slong ba 'di lta bus yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis ni sbyin pa'i dngos po nyes pas ma rung bar gyur pa'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa gtong ba sla ba nyid du ston par 'dod pas brtsams pa yin no //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThis beggar‚Äù shows the giving of a gift that is defective due to the fault of the thing given and the ease of giving.

original: cung zad ces bya ba ni 'chi ba'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni 'chi ba'i chos can yin la /
translated: ‚Äú A little‚Äù means that it is subject to death.

original: ji srid du 'dug pa de srid du yang mi bde ba'i gnas su gyur cing mi bde ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du 'dug pa de srid du yang mi bde ba'i gnas su gyur cing mi bde ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
translated: For as long as it remains, it is a basis for unhappiness and a cause of unhappiness.

original: rga ba dang nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthe tshom za ba'ang zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'am /
analyzed: rga ba dang nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro // the tshom za ba'ang zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'am /
translated: Because it is the basis for the suffering of old age, sickness, etc.

original: sbyin par mi bya zhes so //
analyzed: sbyin par mi bya zhes so //
translated: ‚Äú Doubt‚Äù means whether or not one should give.

original: rgya cher mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni slong ba'i skye bo nyid do //
analyzed: rgya cher mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni slong ba'i skye bo nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Not extensive‚Äù means the person who begs.

original: 'jungs shing zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jungs shing zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Stingy and timid‚Äù means not wanting to give.

original: mun pa'i mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rab mchog ste /
analyzed: mun pa'i mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rab mchog ste /
translated: ‚Äú The worst darkness‚Äù means the worst delusion.

original: de bas na the tshom za ba yang mi rigs pa nyid na /
analyzed: de bas na the tshom za ba yang mi rigs pa nyid na /
translated: Therefore, it is not right to hesitate,

original: mi sbyin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: mi sbyin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: much less not to give.

original: rang gi lus la rtsa bkros te /
analyzed: rang gi lus la rtsa bkros te /
translated: He should heat his own body

original: gnod sbyin de rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnod sbyin de rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and give it to those yakshas.

original: dang po nyid du rjes su 'dod pa ni 'di nyid du yin pas so //
analyzed: dang po nyid du rjes su 'dod pa ni 'di nyid du yin pas so //
translated: This is because the first desire is for this very thing.

original: chos kyi grogs kyang bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi grogs kyang bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should also act as a Dharma friend.

original: slong ba rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so ;
analyzed: slong ba rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so ;
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúBeggars are the spiritual teacher of the bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: /'di ni re zhig 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: /'di ni re zhig 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
translated: This is the benefit in a future life.

original: nga yang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
analyzed: nga yang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
translated: I will be very happy. This is the benefit in this life.

original: chos dga' ba de gnyis kyi dngos pos ni 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: chos dga' ba de gnyis kyi dngos pos ni 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa las ldog pa ste /
translated: By means of these two kinds of delight in the Dharma, he turns away from the destruction of grasping.

original: de'i phan yon rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phan yon rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: These are the two kinds of benefits that are shown.

original: snyim pa bzed de zhes bya ba smos pas ni snod dang 'brim pas dus las 'das kyis dogs pa'o //
analyzed: snyim pa bzed de zhes bya ba smos pas ni snod dang 'brim pas dus las 'das kyis dogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase holding out his joined palms indicates that he is afraid that the time for the vessel and the distribution will pass.

original: 'dir khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the difference here,

original: tsandan dmar po'i khu ba 'dra ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: tsandan dmar po'i khu ba 'dra ba zhes smos te /
translated: he says, red like the juice of red sandalwood.

original: dmar ba'i khyad par ni rgyal po de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dmar ba'i khyad par ni rgyal po de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The difference in redness is the characteristic of that king.

original: khrag gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad @192b par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrag gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad @192b par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show the difference in the characteristic of blood,

original: mtshams dus kyi char sprin lta bu ni khrag go //
analyzed: mtshams dus kyi char sprin lta bu ni khrag go //
translated: he says, like the clouds at the end of the rainy season.

original: khrag dang 'brel pa de ni gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: khrag dang 'brel pa de ni gnod sbyin no //
translated: The blood is related to the yaksha.

original: dga' ba mchog dang ldan pas lus kyang ma nyams pa ni brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba mchog dang ldan pas lus kyang ma nyams pa ni brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing supreme joy, his body is also unimpaired, which is to say, he is firm.

original: sems kyang brgyal ba med pa ni lus kyi yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyang brgyal ba med pa ni lus kyi yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: His mind is also not faint, which is to say, he possesses the good qualities of the body.

original: khrag gi rgyun kyang zad par yong ma gyur to //
analyzed: khrag gi rgyun kyang zad par yong ma gyur to //
translated: The flow of blood has not yet ceased.

original: da ni 'dis 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni khrag de dgag pa ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dis 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni khrag de dgag pa ste /
translated: Now, he says, I know this, which is to say, he stops the blood.

original: gang gzhan sngar bslangs par gyur pa de ni byin par gyur to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gzhan sngar bslangs par gyur pa de ni byin par gyur to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that what was previously given is given again.

original: sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ba'i gnas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ba'i gnas //
translated: The basis for the occurrence of many kinds of suffering.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //üîΩbyas pa mi gzo zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gtsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to // byas pa mi gzo zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gtsang ba nyid de /
translated: This shows that it is suffering.üîΩIt is ungrateful.

original: gtsang ba'i rdzas kyis bskyed kyang yang mi gtsang ba nyid yongs su mi 'dor bas so //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i rdzas kyis bskyed kyang yang mi gtsang ba nyid yongs su mi 'dor bas so //
translated: This shows that it is impure, because even though it is generated by pure substances, it does not abandon its own impure nature.

original: yang na sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ba'i gnas de nyid kyi khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ba'i gnas de nyid kyi khyad par gyi don to //
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of the term is a basis for the occurrence of many kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gso ba'i gzhi'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gso ba'i gzhi'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is a basis for the treatment of suffering.

original: slong ba rnams kyi bsnyen bkur ni slong ba rnams la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba rnams kyi bsnyen bkur ni slong ba rnams la sbyin pa'o //
translated: The worship of those who seek is the giving of gifts to those who seek.

translated: The teaching is the examination of the Samkhyas, the Yogis, and the Lokayatas.

analyzed: rang gi chos dang las la 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang / las dang / rigs kyi'o //

analyzed: yang na thams cad kyi las kyi 'tsho ba'o //

analyzed: chos ni 'jig rten pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya pa'o //

analyzed: yid ma byung zhing bde bar 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pas yid skyo ba med pa'o //

original: yang na skyo ba med pa ni 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na skyo ba med pa ni 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, without sorrow means without harm.

original: bde bar 'tsho ba ni lo legs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bde bar 'tsho ba ni lo legs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas so //
translated: Living happily means having the qualities of a good harvest, etc.

analyzed: snying nye ba ni rgyal po'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pas so //

original: bka' khrims ni don gyi bstan bcos so //
analyzed: bka' khrims ni don gyi bstan bcos so //

original: rang gi chos dang las dang 'bad pa dang yid ma byung zhing bde bar 'tsho ba dang / 'tsho tshis byas pa legs par 'byor pa zhes bya ba dag gis ni rnam par 'phel ba bstan to //

translated: The words his own Dharma, his own actions, his own efforts, his own mind, his own livelihood, and his own good fortune indicate the increase of his power.

original: yon tan ldan pas zhes bya bas ni thob pa rnam par spel ba dang / yongs su bsrung ba dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ldan pas zhes bya bas ni thob pa rnam par spel ba dang / yongs su bsrung ba dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The words endowed with good qualities indicate the increase of his attainment and the control of his protection.

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pas zhes bya ba'i phyed kyis ni yon tan dang ldan pa des rang bzhin gyis nyams pa med pa bstan te /

original: des na yang de bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na yang de bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin te /

original: 'dis ni gsang tshig gi nus pa bstan to //

original: 'dis ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni skye bo mang po'i g-yog 'khor gyi 'bras bu yin te /

analyzed: shes pa'i nga rgyal med ces bya ba 'dis ni ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa la bag yod pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase he is without pride in his knowledge indicates the conscientious attitude in the accumulation of the wisdom.

analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pas nga rgyal skye bar gyur na ni bdag nyid la bstod cing gzhan la smod par byed de /
translated: For, if he were to generate pride on account of his knowledge, he would praise himself and disparage others.

analyzed: bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po dag tu shes rab nyams par gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has stated in the MahƒÅyƒÅna that the degeneration of wisdom is the praise of oneself and the disparagement of others.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs la bag yod par bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs la bag yod par bstan to //
translated: Thus, he teaches the conscientious attitude in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: yang na mkhas par gyur kyang shes pa'i nga rgyal med ces bya bas ni shes pas ngoms pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang na mkhas par gyur kyang shes pa'i nga rgyal med ces bya bas ni shes pas ngoms pa med pa bstan to //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase even though he is wise, he is without pride in his knowledge indicates that he is insatiable in his knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs la yang dang yang du sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs la yang dang yang du sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He is one who repeatedly applies himself to the accumulation of wisdom.

analyzed: dpal dang ldan zhing 'byor yang zhes bya bas ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa nyid do//

original: dregs pa med ces bya ba la dregs pa ni dpal gyi dregs pas dregs pa nyid de /
analyzed: dregs pa med ces bya ba la dregs pa ni dpal gyi dregs pas dregs pa nyid de /
translated: He is not proud means that he is not proud because of the pride of prosperity.üîΩTherefore, if he were to engage in pride, he would not engage in the accumulation of the merit of generosity.üîΩHe is not proud means that he is not proud because of the pride of prosperity.

original: de bas na drags pa des 'jug na ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na drags pa des 'jug na ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if he were to engage in pride, he would not engage in the accumulation of the merit of generosity.
