translated: In order to show that, although he has abandoned a bed and seat, he has a special bed and seat,

original: nags tshal dag na mtshan mo'i zla 'od ni //
analyzed: nags tshal dag na mtshan mo'i zla 'od ni //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn the forest, the moonlight at night. . . . ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the verse.

original: reg pa dang dri zhim pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas su tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa dang dri zhim pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas su tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: In a place that is endowed with contact and a pleasant smell, these two verses are taught in order.

original: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa'i shugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa'i shugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of grief and distress.

original: mya ngan dang gdungs pa gnyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don gyi rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang gdungs pa gnyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don gyi rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Grief and distress should be understood in the same way as explained above.

original: brgyal ba bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar gyur pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: brgyal ba bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar gyur pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Like one who has fainted, means like one who has fainted.

original: dran pa med par gyur pa las phyis yang dran pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩsmyo bla can du gyur pa yin //
analyzed: dran pa med par gyur pa las phyis yang dran pa dang ldan pa'o // smyo bla can du gyur pa yin //
translated: Having become without mindfulness, later one again has mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par 'khrugs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par 'khrugs pa thob pa'o //
translated: One becomes insane, means one obtains a disturbed mind.

original: grib shing lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: grib shing lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: Like a shade tree, means like a shade tree.

original: phongs pa'i tsha bas mngon par gdungs shing 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon par yun ring por yongs su dub pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phongs pa'i tsha bas mngon par gdungs shing 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon par yun ring por yongs su dub pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to remove the suffering of sentient beings who are tormented by the heat of misfortune and who are exhausted from a long time in the wilderness of cyclic existence.

original: bzhin khro gnyer med pa dang tshig gi lan la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bzhin khro gnyer med pa dang tshig gi lan la sogs pas so //
translated: The tree is without a frowning face, because it does not respond with words, etc.

original: 'bras bu zhim po yod pa zhes bya ba ni gus par byed pas ji ltar bsams pa'i 'dod pa'i don ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhim po yod pa zhes bya ba ni gus par byed pas ji ltar bsams pa'i 'dod pa'i don ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has a delicious fruit, because it bestows the desired aim in accordance with the thought of the one who is devoted to it.

original: shing lta bu ni gzhan gyi don byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: shing lta bu ni gzhan gyi don byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The tree is like the one who acts for the benefit of others and engages in its fruit.

original: sta ris gzas pa rnams 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'i 'bras bu sems pa'o //
analyzed: sta ris gzas pa rnams 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'i 'bras bu sems pa'o //
translated: The tree is like the one who holds those who are seized by the axe, because the fruit of holding is intention.

original: chu gtsang zhim po bsil ba'i rdzing bu zhes bya ba ni mtsho la sogs pa gang 'thungs na bsil ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / chu zhim pa'i chus gang ba yin pa dang / bsil ba ni dbul ba'i sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu gtsang zhim po bsil ba'i rdzing bu zhes bya ba ni mtsho la sogs pa gang 'thungs na bsil ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / chu zhim pa'i chus gang ba yin pa dang / bsil ba ni dbul ba'i sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The tree is like the one who is a cool, delicious, pure water pond, because it is a pond, etc. which, when drunk, is cool, stainless, and filled with delicious water. It is cool because it removes the suffering of poverty.

original: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from afflictions.

original: zhi ba ni gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyis yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyis yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Peace is pleasant because it is distinguished by the practice of respect, and so on.

original: 'dral ba dag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa 'dod cing dbul ba bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dral ba dag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa 'dod cing dbul ba bzlog pa'o //
translated: They are dissipated because they desire destruction and are opposed to wealth.

original: ming la ni don med ces bya ba ni 'di dag don dang ldan pa ma yin te 'dod dga'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ming la ni don med ces bya ba ni 'di dag don dang ldan pa ma yin te 'dod dga'i ming ngo //
translated: They are without meaning because they do not have meaning, but are just sounds of pleasure.

original: yang na don dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang gud du song ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang na don dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang gud du song ba zhes smos te /
translated: Or, even if they do have meaning, they are gone elsewhere, as it is said.

original: yul phyogs gzhan du song zhing nye ba dag na mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul phyogs gzhan du song zhing nye ba dag na mi gnas pa'o //
translated: They are not present in the vicinity, but have gone to another place.

original: @203b yang na grags pa zad ces bya ba smas te med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @203b yang na grags pa zad ces bya ba smas te med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, their fame is exhausted, as it is said. The meaning is that they do not exist.

original: grib shing 'bras bu zhim po yod pa dag dang dri ma med pa dang / gtsang zhing zhim pa'i chus gang ba'i rdzing bu zhes smos pas ni ngal bso ba'i gnas dang / bza' ba dang btung ba'i sdug bsngal gso ba'i thun mong gi rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: grib shing 'bras bu zhim po yod pa dag dang dri ma med pa dang / gtsang zhing zhim pa'i chus gang ba'i rdzing bu zhes smos pas ni ngal bso ba'i gnas dang / bza' ba dang btung ba'i sdug bsngal gso ba'i thun mong gi rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi dgos pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is the common requirement of all sentient beings,

original: grib shing dang rdzing bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grib shing dang rdzing bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is like a tree and a pond.

original: de ltar re zhig 'bras bu zhim po yod pa zhes bya ba dang / chu gtsang zhim po zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bskrad pa'i sgo nas bdag gi sdug bsngal las brtsams te smre sngags 'don pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'bras bu zhim po yod pa zhes bya ba dang / chu gtsang zhim po zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bskrad pa'i sgo nas bdag gi sdug bsngal las brtsams te smre sngags 'don pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, in these two verses, a tree with delicious fruit and pure, sweet water, the bodhisattva has demonstrated his lamentations in terms of his own suffering through his abandonment of it.

original: gang na rgyal po thams cad sgrol zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' spyugs pa'i dbang du byas nas smre sngags 'don pa bstan to//
analyzed: gang na rgyal po thams cad sgrol zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' spyugs pa'i dbang du byas nas smre sngags 'don pa bstan to//
translated: The verse Where is the king called Vi≈õvantara? shows the lamentations from the point of view of the banished Bodhisattva.

original: bdag cag phongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal las brtsams so //üîΩnor bu rin po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag phongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal las brtsams so // nor bu rin po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The verse We are in distress shows the suffering of the Bodhisattva himself.üîΩThe phrase the precious jewel and so on shows the power of the conventional thing.

original: nor dang 'bru mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar dogs pa'i dngos po bzung ba'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar dogs pa'i dngos po bzung ba'o //
translated: The phrase much wealth and grain and so on shows the power of the thing to be feared.üîΩThe phrase the excellent and delightful park shows the power of the thing to be enjoyed.

original: nye 'khor skyed mos tshal bzang po yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de ni nye 'khor skyed mos tshal bzang po yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor skyed mos tshal bzang po yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de ni nye 'khor skyed mos tshal bzang po yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The phrase in due course shows the power of the thing to be attained.

original: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi mchog las so //
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi mchog las so //
translated: The phrase the excellent city shows the power of the thing to be attained.

original: 'das pa 'di rim gyis zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩgrong dang grong khyer las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa 'di rim gyis zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩgrong dang grong khyer las 'das pa'o //
translated: The phrase in due course shows the power of the thing to be attained.

original: grib shing bar mtshams med pa'i dgon pa gang yin pa de ni grib shing bar mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: grib shing bar mtshams med pa'i dgon pa gang yin pa de ni grib shing bar mtshams med pa'o //
translated: The monastery that is without gaps between the trees is the one that is without gaps between the trees.

original: rab tu rgyu ba phyogs gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rab tu rgyu bas phyogs gsal bar snang ba'o //üîΩshing rta 'dren pa'i rta ni gzhan ma yin ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu rgyu ba phyogs gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rab tu rgyu bas phyogs gsal bar snang ba'o // shing rta 'dren pa'i rta ni gzhan ma yin ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The direction that is illuminated by the light is the one that is illuminated by the light.üîΩThe horse that is yoked to the chariot is the one that is yoked to the chariot.

original: dpag tshad du ma'i lam du zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i don rta byin pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tshad du ma'i lam du zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i don rta byin pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this verse is that he gave the horse.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sbyin pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: Because he delighted in giving.

original: de bas na sgrub pa'i khyad par mtha' dag 'dir dpag tshad du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub pa'i khyad par mtha' dag 'dir dpag tshad du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Therefore, all the particulars of the practice are mentioned here in the verse beginning with many yojanas.

original: @204a * // 'di dag las gzhan med pas de sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @204a * // 'di dag las gzhan med pas de sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is nothing else besides these, it is not accomplished.

original: lam du de lus la zhes bya ba ni rta de byin pa'i slong bas de nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: lam du de lus la zhes bya ba ni rta de byin pa'i slong bas de nyid du bstan to //
translated: In the path, on his body refers to the horse that was given. The beggar showed it right there.

original: dpag tshad du ma ni dus mang po'i dbang du bstan to //
analyzed: dpag tshad du ma ni dus mang po'i dbang du bstan to //
translated: Many yojanas is taught in terms of a long time.

original: grogs ni med gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan de na byed pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: grogs ni med gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan de na byed pa med pa'o ;
translated: Even if there are no friends means that there is no other agent there.

original: / bu smad bcas shing zhes bya ba ni don gnyer ba'i gzhan gyi don nyid de /
analyzed: / bu smad bcas shing zhes bya ba ni don gnyer ba'i gzhan gyi don nyid de /
translated: Together with wife and children means that it is the very benefit of others who are objects of one's own compassion.

original: de yang rang gi skyo ba bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi skyo ba bzod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the forbearance of one's own weariness.

original: phyi rjes mi lta bar zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de bcos pa'i rgyu thob pa dag gsal ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rjes mi lta bar zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de bcos pa'i rgyu thob pa dag gsal ba'o //
translated: Not looking for reward means that one is not concerned with the cause of the alleviation of that suffering.

original: rta bzhin ni thams cad lus pa med par byin pa'o //
analyzed: rta bzhin ni thams cad lus pa med par byin pa'o //
translated: Like a horse means that one gives everything without reserve.

original: tshig rkang de dag gis ni sbyin pa la dga' ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig rkang de dag gis ni sbyin pa la dga' ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: These lines show the very cause of delight in generosity.

original: nags zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi nags so //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi nags so //
translated: Forest means a forest of asceticism.

original: goms kyang zhes bya ba ni yun ring por shin tu goms pa ste yun ring du rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par sbyor ba dang ldan pa des so //
analyzed: goms kyang zhes bya ba ni yun ring por shin tu goms pa ste yun ring du rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par sbyor ba dang ldan pa des so //
translated: Even though one is accustomed means that one is accustomed to it for a long time, for a long time one practices it constantly and with devoted application.

original: dam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: dam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The holy ones are the bodhisattvas.

original: yon tan la goms pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba byed pa la goms pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan la goms pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba byed pa la goms pa ste /
translated: Accustomed to virtue means accustomed to benefiting and gladdening others.

original: gang la gang zhig byed pa de nyid de'i bsod nams kyi stobs yin gyi byed pa po'i yon tan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la gang zhig byed pa de nyid de'i bsod nams kyi stobs yin gyi byed pa po'i yon tan ni ma yin no //
translated: The power of the merit of that very one who acts for the benefit of others is the cause of the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings, not the quality of the agent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad la phan zhing bde ba la 'jug pa ni mi 'grub par snang bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan zhing bde ba la 'jug pa ni mi 'grub par snang bas so //
translated: Because it is seen that the engagement in the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings is not accomplished.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan zhing bde bar 'jug par gyur na yang /
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan zhing bde bar 'jug par gyur na yang /
translated: For example, even though the bodhisattva is engaged in the benefit and happiness of others,

original: yi dags dang dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i sems can bde bar 'jug pa grub pa med pas so //
analyzed: yi dags dang dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i sems can bde bar 'jug pa grub pa med pas so //
translated: the engagement in the benefit and happiness of sentient beings who are born as hungry ghosts, hell-beings, and so on is not accomplished.

original: ku mu ta'i kha 'byed pa'i zla ba yang gal te zla ba kha 'byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ku mu ta'i kha 'byed pa'i zla ba yang gal te zla ba kha 'byed pa yin na ni /
translated: Even the moon that causes the opening of the kumuda flower, if it is the cause of the opening of the kumuda flower,

original: ci'i phyir padma kha 'byed par mi byed de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir padma kha 'byed par mi byed de /
translated: why does it not cause the opening of the lotus flower?

original: khyad par med par ltos shing kha 'byed rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: khyad par med par ltos shing kha 'byed rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: Because it is seen that the moon is the cause of the opening of the kumuda flower, and the cause of the non-opening of the lotus flower, without distinction.

original: rang gi nus pa'i khyad par nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mtsho'i nang na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa'i khyad par nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mtsho'i nang na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not the special power of the moon, the verse says, ‚ÄúIn the lake, the moon is not the cause of the opening of the kumuda flowers.‚Äù

original: skar ma rnams kyi gzugs brnyan ni skar ma rnams kyi gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: skar ma rnams kyi gzugs brnyan ni skar ma rnams kyi gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The reflection of the stars is the reflection of the stars.

original: des mdzes pa'i skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams lhag par mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: des mdzes pa'i skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams lhag par mdzes pa ste /
translated: The reflection of the stars is especially beautiful in the lake.

original: ku mu ta rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'i mtsho'i nang nas skar ma'i @204b gzugs brnyan de dag la'o //
analyzed: ku mu ta rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'i mtsho'i nang nas skar ma'i @204b gzugs brnyan de dag la'o //
translated: The reflection of the stars in the lake is like the opening of the day-lotus.

original: ku mu ta rnam par dag pas ni lhag par skar ma'i gzugs brnyan mdzes pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ku mu ta rnam par dag pas ni lhag par skar ma'i gzugs brnyan mdzes pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: The reflection of the stars is especially beautiful in the pure day-lotus, not in any other.

original: 'dis ni ku mu ta kha 'byed pa dag tsam 'dir ni brjod la gzhan gyi rgyan gyi don du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ku mu ta kha 'byed pa dag tsam 'dir ni brjod la gzhan gyi rgyan gyi don du bstan to //
translated: Here, the opening of the day-lotus is mentioned as an example, and the other is taught as the ornament.üîΩLike the rays of the moon, it is a spectacle, this is said.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer ltad mo lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtsho'i nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams ku mu ta rgyas pa mthong na lhag par ltad mo lta bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer ltad mo lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtsho'i nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams ku mu ta rgyas pa mthong na lhag par ltad mo lta bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The reflection of the stars in the lake is a spectacle when the opening of the day-lotus is seen.

original: rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma tsam du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma tsam du gyur pa ste /
translated: The cause is the mere sign.

original: zla bas kha 'byed par byas pa ni zla ba 'char ba'i dus su de kha 'byed par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zla bas kha 'byed par byas pa ni zla ba 'char ba'i dus su de kha 'byed par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The moon opens them because they appear to open when the moon rises.

original: gal te kha 'byed pa'i nus pa yod par gyur na ni padma la sogs pa ci'i phyir kha 'byed par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te kha 'byed pa'i nus pa yod par gyur na ni padma la sogs pa ci'i phyir kha 'byed par mi byed /
translated: If they have the power to open, why don‚Äôt they open lotuses and so on?

original: de bzhin du bdag gis bsams na rgyal po khyod kyi mthu stobs yin snyam na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis bsams na rgyal po khyod kyi mthu stobs yin snyam na /
translated: Similarly, if you think it is the power of the king,

original: ri dags kyi mchog dag ni thams cad du mnyam par rab tu gnas pa dang bcas pa yin ba'i phyir khyed nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: ri dags kyi mchog dag ni thams cad du mnyam par rab tu gnas pa dang bcas pa yin ba'i phyir khyed nyid kyi'o //
translated: the supreme deer are always well-established everywhere, so it is yours.

original: gcig la gcig snyan par smra zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig la gcig snyan par smra zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: They speak pleasantly to each other.

original: re zhig rigs pa ni mad dris byang chub sems dpa' la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni de la snyan par smra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rigs pa ni mad dris byang chub sems dpa' la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni de la snyan par smra ba ma yin no //
translated: First, it is not reasonable for a bodhisattva to speak pleasantly to a bodhisattva.üîΩLoving kindness towards the newly arrived is explained by this ‚Äúthey speak pleasantly to each other.‚Äù

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la byams pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni glo bur du 'ongs pa yid la byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la byams pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni glo bur du 'ongs pa yid la byed pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the newly arrived mental attention.

original: gcig la gcig snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: They speak pleasantly to each other.

original: bu smad ces bya ba ni mad dri dang gzhon nu gnyis so //
analyzed: bu smad ces bya ba ni mad dri dang gzhon nu gnyis so //
translated: Sons and daughters are the two, Manidhara and Kumara.

original: phab nas ni babs su bcug pa'o //
analyzed: phab nas ni babs su bcug pa'o //
translated: Having descended means having caused to descend.

original: rgyab tu zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gro ba la skyob pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rgyab tu zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gro ba la skyob pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By on his back he shows that he is a protector while going.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni 'di ltar kha zas kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar kha zas kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is because of this that he is called the one who is the lord of food.

original: mngon du lta byed cing zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du lta byed cing zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Looking at means seeking.

original: ze ba rnams kyi rdul de ste de lhags pas khyab cing gsal bar gyur pa'i ser po gang yin pa de ni ze ba lhags pas ser por gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ze ba rnams kyi rdul de ste de lhags pas khyab cing gsal bar gyur pa'i ser po gang yin pa de ni ze ba lhags pas ser por gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The pollen of the lotuses is the yellow color that is pervaded by the dust of the lotuses that have been struck by the sun's rays.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In order to show that he is fearless due to the suffering of being tormented by the sun's rays,

original: sprin rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: sprin rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: he says the clouds in the verse.

original: de'i phyed kyis ni lam gyis yongs su dub pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i dbang du byas pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyed kyis ni lam gyis yongs su dub pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i dbang du byas pas so //
translated: By half of that he shows that he is fearless due to the suffering of being exhausted by the path.

original: ngal ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya @205a * //
analyzed: ngal ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya @205a * //
translated: The suffering of fatigue.

original: ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis mi 'chag pa'i 'jig pa med cing bde ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis mi 'chag pa'i 'jig pa med cing bde ba'o //
translated: The first half of the verse shows that there is no destruction of non-wandering and it is happiness.

original: 'chag pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yin pas 'chag pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yin pas 'chag pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: Wandering itself is destruction, so it is the destruction of wandering.

original: de nyid bde ba yin pas 'chag pa rnam par 'jig pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba yin pas 'chag pa rnam par 'jig pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: That itself is happiness, so it is the happiness of the destruction of wandering.

original: lam gyis dub pa de'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni lam du 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ste des so //
analyzed: lam gyis dub pa de'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni lam du 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ste des so //
translated: The suffering feeling of fatigue from the path is the suffering feeling of going on the path.

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo mas brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa ni shing ljon pa'o //
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo mas brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa ni shing ljon pa'o //
translated: A tree adorned with flowers, fruits, and leaves is a tree.

original: snum pa yang yin la rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin pas snum snum ltar 'dug pa rnam pa du ma'i shing ljon pa ste /
analyzed: snum pa yang yin la rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin pas snum snum ltar 'dug pa rnam pa du ma'i shing ljon pa ste /
translated: It is oily and has various aspects, so it is a tree with various oily appearances.

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma rnams kyis brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa snum snum ltar 'dug pa rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma rnams kyis brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa snum snum ltar 'dug pa rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: It is a tree with various oily appearances adorned with flowers, fruits, and leaves.

original: gang ba ni me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma rnams kyis brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa snum snum ltar 'dug pa du mas gang ba ste sems med pa'i dga' pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba ni me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma rnams kyis brgyan pa'i shing ljon pa snum snum ltar 'dug pa du mas gang ba ste sems med pa'i dga' pa'o //
translated: Filled with trees that are as if anointed with oil, filled with trees that are adorned with flowers, fruits, and leaves, it is a mindless delight.

original: 'dod pas myong ba'i dga' ba yang yin la bya yang yin pas 'dod pas dga' ba'i bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas myong ba'i dga' ba yang yin la bya yang yin pas 'dod pas dga' ba'i bya'o //
translated: Since it is a delight experienced through desire and it is a bird, it is a bird of desirous delight.

original: du ma'i sgra ni mang po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: du ma'i sgra ni mang po'i sgra'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is a word for a multitude.

original: de dag gi sgrogs pa ni mang po'i sgra 'byin par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sgrogs pa ni mang po'i sgra 'byin par ro //
translated: Their sound is the sound of a multitude.

original: 'dod pas myos shing rab tu dga' ba mang po sgra 'byin pa'i dka' thub kyi nags tshal gang la yod pa de ni bya mang po 'dod pas myos shing dga' bas sgra 'byin pa'i dka' thub kyi nags tshal lo //
analyzed: 'dod pas myos shing rab tu dga' ba mang po sgra 'byin pa'i dka' thub kyi nags tshal gang la yod pa de ni bya mang po 'dod pas myos shing dga' bas sgra 'byin pa'i dka' thub kyi nags tshal lo //
translated: The forest of asceticism in which there is the sound of a multitude of birds intoxicated with desire and delight is a forest of asceticism with the sound of a multitude of birds intoxicated with desire and delight.

original: gang du ri dags kyi rnam pa du ma rgyu ba de ni ri dags kyi rigs rnam pa du ma rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gang du ri dags kyi rnam pa du ma rgyu ba de ni ri dags kyi rigs rnam pa du ma rgyu ba'o //
translated: Where there is the roaming of many types of deer, it is a place where many types of deer roam.

original: gar byed pa gang yin pa de ni gar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gar byed pa gang yin pa de ni gar byed pa nyid do //
translated: Dancing is dancing itself.

original: gar byed pa nyid rma bya yin pas rma bya mang po gar byed pa ste des mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: gar byed pa nyid rma bya yin pas rma bya mang po gar byed pa ste des mdzes pa'o //
translated: The peacocks are dancing, and they are beautiful because of that.

original: me tog gi dris bsgos pa ni me tog gi dris bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi dris bsgos pa ni me tog gi dris bsgos pa'o //
translated: Perfumed with flower fragrance means perfumed with the fragrance of flowers.

original: dka' thub kyi nags tshal gang du me tog gi dris bsgos pa'i ser bu ldang ba dang ldan pa de ni lam gyi rdul gyis rkang pa dang byin pa rtsub rtsub ltar 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub kyi nags tshal gang du me tog gi dris bsgos pa'i ser bu ldang ba dang ldan pa de ni lam gyi rdul gyis rkang pa dang byin pa rtsub rtsub ltar 'dug pa'o //
translated: The forest of ascetics is where the breeze rises perfumed with the fragrance of flowers.

original: ngal bas nyams pa'i mdog dang mig rtsa gang yin pa de ni ngal bas bzhin mdog dang mig rtsa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ngal bas nyams pa'i mdog dang mig rtsa gang yin pa de ni ngal bas bzhin mdog dang mig rtsa nyams pa'o //
translated: The complexion and eyes that are fatigued by exertion are the complexion and eyes that are fatigued by exertion.

original: dbyig pa la btags shing phrag pa la thogs pa'i spyi blugs gang yin pa de ni spyi blugs dbyig pa la btags pa phrag pa la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyig pa la btags shing phrag pa la thogs pa'i spyi blugs gang yin pa de ni spyi blugs dbyig pa la btags pa phrag pa la thogs pa'o //
translated: The water pot hung on the shoulder and fastened with a strap is the water pot hung on the shoulder and fastened with a strap.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la bkur sti'i bya ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni glo bur du 'ongs pa la bkur sti'i bya ba byas so //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la bkur sti'i bya ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni glo bur du 'ongs pa la bkur sti'i bya ba byas so //
translated: The act of honoring the newly arrived is the act of honoring the newly arrived.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba @205b ni mi bzad pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba @205b ni mi bzad pa ste /
translated: These beings are unbearable,

original: mi bzad pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzad pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have unbearable minds.

original: ser sna'i mos pa yin pas ser snas bsgribs pa'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ser sna'i mos pa yin pas ser snas bsgribs pa'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: They are beings who are obscured by miserliness, because they are devoted to miserliness.

original: 'di gnyis ni sems mi bzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten snang ba med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni sems mi bzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten snang ba med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: These two are taught as the non-illumination of the world, because of the unbearableness of the mind.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyed las gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyed las gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Other than that means other than you.

original: slong ba nyid ni slong ba'o //üîΩslong ba nyid kyi tshig yin pas slong ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: slong ba nyid ni slong ba'o // slong ba nyid kyi tshig yin pas slong ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Begging is the same as a beggar.üîΩThe word beggar is the word for a beggar.

original: don du gnyer ba'i tshig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i tshig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the word for one who is in need.

original: ma phyin pa ni mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ma phyin pa ni mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Not arriving means not able.

original: snang ba med pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the non-illumination of the world and the unevenness of the world.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: mi mnyam pa'i lam las 'jig rten 'gro ba nyid du snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i lam las 'jig rten 'gro ba nyid du snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the world appears to go by the uneven path.

original: gzhan ni mi 'gro ba yin no zhes don gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi 'gro ba yin no zhes don gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is understood that others do not go.

original: de bas na bstan pa'i skyon gnyis med de /
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa'i skyon gnyis med de /
translated: Therefore, the two faults of the teaching do not exist.

original: mthong bzhin du lam mnyam pa nas 'gro bar snang ba'i phyir khyod nyid la phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong bzhin du lam mnyam pa nas 'gro bar snang ba'i phyir khyod nyid la phyin pa yin la /
translated: Since it appears that one goes along the even path while seeing, you yourself have gone.

original: gzhan pa mi slong ba'i tshig phyin pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa mi slong ba'i tshig phyin pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not gone‚Äù does not incite another.

original: de'i rgyu skyon gnyis dang bral ba med na ni de ji ltar slong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rgyu skyon gnyis dang bral ba med na ni de ji ltar slong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: If the absence of the two faults of the cause does not exist, then how is it that, in consideration of the incitement,

original: sbyin pa la dpa' ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la dpa' ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin no //
translated: the verse ‚Äúthe brave one in generosity‚Äù is stated?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni grags pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni grags pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the fame that is heard.

original: stsol zhes bya ba ni slong mo pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stsol zhes bya ba ni slong mo pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGive‚Äù means because of the acceptance of the state of a beggar.

original: ci'i phyir khyod la slong zhes de ltar rtog pa la g-yog tu zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod la slong zhes de ltar rtog pa la g-yog tu zhes pas bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy do you beg?‚Äù In this way, the thought is taught by ‚Äúas a servant.‚Äù

original: tsham tshom med par sbyin zhes bya ba ni dpyad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tsham tshom med par sbyin zhes bya ba ni dpyad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGive without hesitation‚Äù means because of the absence of analysis.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sbyin pa la dga' ba goms par byas pa'i rab tu sdug pa'i bu bas kyang sbyin pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la dga' ba goms par byas pa'i rab tu sdug pa'i bu bas kyang sbyin pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: One who is accustomed to delight in generosity delights in giving even more than a dearly beloved son.

original: ches gces pa'i phyir ji ltar sbyin pa la dga' ba goms par byas pa de lta bu la dga' ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ches gces pa'i phyir ji ltar sbyin pa la dga' ba goms par byas pa de lta bu la dga' ba ni ma yin te /
translated: One who is accustomed to delight in generosity does not delight in giving to the same degree as one who is not accustomed to delight in generosity.

original: bu la dga' ba ni res 'ga' byas pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba ni rgyun du goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu la dga' ba ni res 'ga' byas pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba ni rgyun du goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because delight in a son is occasional, and delight in generosity is habitual.

original: de yang bu ni mi rtag pa la goms par so sor brtags pa des lhag par dga' ba med la /
analyzed: de yang bu ni mi rtag pa la goms par so sor brtags pa des lhag par dga' ba med la /
translated: Moreover, one who is accustomed to contemplating the impermanence of a son has no excessive delight in him.

original: sbyin pa ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan par snang bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan par snang bas so //
translated: But generosity appears to have all good qualities.

original: yang na thams cad pas sbyin pa ni che ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na thams cad pas sbyin pa ni che ba nyid do //
translated: Or else, generosity is superior to all the others.

original: sbyin pa las dga' bas bu gnyis kyang tsham tshom med par sbyin pa zhes bya ba @206a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa las dga' bas bu gnyis kyang tsham tshom med par sbyin pa zhes bya ba @206a * //
translated: One who delights in generosity gives even his two sons without hesitation.

original: ma byin pa'i dngos po nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ma byin pa'i dngos po nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that he does not keep anything for himself.

original: bu gnyis kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig tu de ltar ci'i phyir smras she na /
analyzed: bu gnyis kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig tu de ltar ci'i phyir smras she na /
translated: Why does the verse say ‚Äúeven his two sons‚Äù?

original: slar bzlog pa ni ma bslabs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slar bzlog pa ni ma bslabs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reply is ‚Äúbecause of not being trained.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa'i bya ba ma yin pas kyang bya ba ma yin pa mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bya ba ma yin pas kyang bya ba ma yin pa mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not being the activity of generosity, it is not the activity, but it is supreme.

original: slar bzlog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dka' ba'i sbyin pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: slar bzlog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dka' ba'i sbyin pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: This reply shows the difficulty of giving.

original: sbyin pa yon tan gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yon tan gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Generosity has two qualities.

original: da 'di na mchis te ci zhig bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te byin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da 'di na mchis te ci zhig bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te byin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat should I do now that I am here?‚Äù means ‚Äúif I give.‚Äù

original: byin pa'i gtam thos nas mi dga' ba skyes pa'i mig rig rig po gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i gtam thos nas skrag pa'i mig rig rig por gyur pa de'o //
analyzed: byin pa'i gtam thos nas mi dga' ba skyes pa'i mig rig rig po gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i gtam thos nas skrag pa'i mig rig rig por gyur pa de'o //
translated: The eyes of the one who is unhappy upon hearing the story of giving are the eyes that are unhappy upon hearing the story of giving.

original: de gnyis kyi snying gdungs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni snying gdungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi snying gdungs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni snying gdungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one whose heart is distressed is the one whose heart is distressed.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba des smras pa de'i lan ni /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba des smras pa de'i lan ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is the reply to what he said.

original: khyod 'di gnyis ngas byin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod 'di gnyis ngas byin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúI have given these two to you‚Äù is the reply.

original: da ni mchis te ci bgyi zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni /
analyzed: da ni mchis te ci bgyi zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni /
translated: The answer to this is:

original: 'di gnyis ma ni song zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ma ni song zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir mother has gone.‚Äù

original: gang du ci'i phyir song zhes bya ba 'bri ba'i tshig gi skabs rtogs pa la nags tshal du rtsa ba 'bras bu tshol du song zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du ci'i phyir song zhes bya ba 'bri ba'i tshig gi skabs rtogs pa la nags tshal du rtsa ba 'bras bu tshol du song zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúWhere and why has she gone?‚Äù The answer is: ‚ÄúTo the forest to gather roots and fruits.‚Äù

original: de yang de ring 'dir 'ong gis //
analyzed: de yang de ring 'dir 'ong gis //
translated: ‚ÄúShe will return today.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ring po mi thogs par 'ong bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ring po mi thogs par 'ong bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that she will return before long.

original: de 'ongs nas ci zhig byed pa yin zhes rtogs pa la de dang phrad nas 'o byas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'ongs nas ci zhig byed pa yin zhes rtogs pa la de dang phrad nas 'o byas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúWhat will she do when she returns?‚Äù The answer is: ‚ÄúShe will embrace her children.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni med dri la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni med dri la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that she is helpful to them.

original: rgyan gyis brgyan cing phreng ba can //
analyzed: rgyan gyis brgyan cing phreng ba can //
translated: ‚ÄúAdorned with ornaments and garlands‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu gnyis so //
translated: refers to the two young men.

original: 'dir ni zhag gcig ngal so la //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhag gcig ngal so la //
translated: ‚ÄúHere they will rest for a day‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni bram ze de la phan 'dogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni bram ze de la phan 'dogs pa bstan te /
translated: shows that she is helpful to the brahmin.

original: lam gyis rngub pa sel bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyis rngub pa sel bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because she appears to relieve the fatigue of the road.

original: bud med rnams ni mi drang bas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma ni bu sbyin pa de la 'gyod par 'gyur ba rjes su shes te /
analyzed: bud med rnams ni mi drang bas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma ni bu sbyin pa de la 'gyod par 'gyur ba rjes su shes te /
translated: This because women are dishonest shows that the mother will regret giving away her son.

original: de bas na khyod kyi sbyin pa la gegs byas par 'gyur bas chos ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin pas zhag gcig 'dug pa'i skyon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyi sbyin pa la gegs byas par 'gyur bas chos ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin pas zhag gcig 'dug pa'i skyon bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since you will be an obstacle to his generosity, you will be unrighteous. This shows the fault of staying for one day.

original: khyod kyi sbyin pa la gegs byed kyis zhes bya ba 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon bstan to //
analyzed: khyod kyi sbyin pa la gegs byed kyis zhes bya ba 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon bstan to //
translated: This because you will be an obstacle to his generosity also shows the fault of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni ma bstan kyang grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni ma bstan kyang grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though he does not teach himself, he is accomplished, because he shows the disadvantage of not giving.

original: sbyin pa ma byin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas gang rnyed pa'i bar chad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa ma byin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas gang rnyed pa'i bar chad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of an obstacle to acquisition is shown by because of the disadvantage of not giving.

original: @206b sbyin pa'i gegs su 'gyur du ma dogs shig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa'i gegs med pa'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @206b sbyin pa'i gegs su 'gyur du ma dogs shig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa'i gegs med pa'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Do not fear being an obstacle to generosity means that there is no obstacle to his own generosity.

original: de nga'i chos spyod pa'i grogs yin mod kyi zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: de nga'i chos spyod pa'i grogs yin mod kyi zhes pa smos te /
translated: Why is that? Because he is a companion in my practice of the Dharma.

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i ming ni g-yon can zhes su btags zhes bya ba de'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i ming ni g-yon can zhes su btags zhes bya ba de'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The answer to the question, What is the name of the one who was previously taught? is the one called the deceiver.

original: da ni nga'i chos spyod pa'i grogs yin mod ces bya ba ni ji ltar nga sbyin pa la dga' ba de ltar de yang dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: da ni nga'i chos spyod pa'i grogs yin mod ces bya ba ni ji ltar nga sbyin pa la dga' ba de ltar de yang dga' ba yin te /
translated: Now, he is indeed a companion in my practice of the Dharma means that just as I delight in generosity, so he delights in it.

original: chos spyod pa'i grogs yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang 'di la khyod ci dgar zad mod //
analyzed: chos spyod pa'i grogs yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang 'di la khyod ci dgar zad mod //
translated: Because he is a companion in the practice of the Dharma.

original: ces bya ba ni gal te khyod khyer bar 'dod na de ring khyod khyer cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te khyod khyer bar 'dod na de ring khyod khyer cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, you may do whatever you like with him means that if you want to take him, take him today.

original: rab tu gzhon zhing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i don gyi yon tan rnam pa gsum dang ldan na ni bran gyi las su 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu gzhon zhing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i don gyi yon tan rnam pa gsum dang ldan na ni bran gyi las su 'os pa yin te /
translated: This verse on being very young has three qualities of meaning. One who has these three qualities is fit to be a servant.

original: las ci 'dod pa bsgrubs pas bdag po dga' ba skyed pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod cing las byed par nus pa dang mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: las ci 'dod pa bsgrubs pas bdag po dga' ba skyed pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod cing las byed par nus pa dang mkhas pa'o //
translated: One who delights the master by accomplishing whatever task is desired, who is able to endure suffering and do the work, and who is wise.

original: gsum po de dag las gang zhig dang yang mi ldan pa med na ni jo bo las byed pas dga' ba bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum po de dag las gang zhig dang yang mi ldan pa med na ni jo bo las byed pas dga' ba bskyed pa yin la /
translated: If he is not devoid of any of these three, then he should be pleased by the master's service.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni yon tan de dag dang mi ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni yon tan de dag dang mi ldan par bstan to //
translated: This verse shows that he is devoid of those virtues.

original: de la nyes pa bstan pa dang / btang ba'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir shi bi pa'i rgyal po nga'i yab ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la nyes pa bstan pa dang / btang ba'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir shi bi pa'i rgyal po nga'i yab ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: In order to show the faults of that and the virtues of giving him up, there are two verses beginning with My father was the king of the Sibis.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa ni bran nyid kyi dngos por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa ni bran nyid kyi dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus it happened means he became a slave.

original: nges par ni gdon mi za bar ro //
analyzed: nges par ni gdon mi za bar ro //
translated: Certainly means without doubt.

original: de'i yul ni zhes bya ba ni shi bi pa'i rgyal po'i yul lo //
analyzed: de'i yul ni zhes bya ba ni shi bi pa'i rgyal po'i yul lo //
translated: His country means the country of the king of the Sibis.

original: de ltar byas na nor chen dang // zhes bya ba ni bu'i glud kyi phyir thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na nor chen dang // zhes bya ba ni bu'i glud kyi phyir thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, he will have great wealth means he will obtain it as a ransom for his son.

original: chos rnams dang yang ldan par 'gyur //
analyzed: chos rnams dang yang ldan par 'gyur //
translated: And he will be endowed with the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni nor chen po de nyid kyis chos byed nus pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nor chen po de nyid kyis chos byed nus pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because of that very great wealth, he is able to practice the Dharma, and because he is free from the afflictions of a fool.

original: sbrul gdug pa dang 'dra ba'i drung du zhes bya ba ni sbrul gdug pa lta bur bsnyen par dka' bas so //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa dang 'dra ba'i drung du zhes bya ba ni sbrul gdug pa lta bur bsnyen par dka' bas so //
translated: In the presence of a poisonous snake means that he is difficult to approach like a poisonous snake.

original: mi dga' ba nyid kyi skyes pa yin pas mi dga' ba'i skyes so //
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid kyi skyes pa yin pas mi dga' ba'i skyes so //
translated: He is a born misanthrope because he is naturally disagreeable.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i drung du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir rgyal pos bdag la 'di gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i drung du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir rgyal pos bdag la 'di gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the disadvantage of approaching a king who has such characteristics, he says, The king said to me, 'You have two choices.'

original: bram ze mo'i g-yog tu bdag ni khrid de mchi @207a * //
analyzed: bram ze mo'i g-yog tu bdag ni khrid de mchi @207a * //
translated: I will go with the brahman woman as my servant.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i gam du mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i gam du mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that he will not go into the king's presence.

original: don yongs su ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni da khyod kyis ji ltar dga' ba de de bzhin du gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: don yongs su ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni da khyod kyis ji ltar dga' ba de de bzhin du gyis shig pa ste /
translated: If the purpose is not fulfilled, means Now, you should do whatever you like.

original: de ltar don yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar don yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not completely fulfilled.

original: g-yog legs par byos zhes bya ba ni bag yod par yongs su spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yog legs par byos zhes bya ba ni bag yod par yongs su spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase serve well means practice with carefulness.

original: de'i bsgrims pa'i mthu zhes bya bas ni 'bad pas rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bsgrims pa'i mthu zhes bya bas ni 'bad pas rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase the power of his exertion means that he engages in practice with effort.

original: des na 'bad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'bad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word exertion is effort.

original: mdor smras nas zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar gyur cig ces so //
analyzed: mdor smras nas zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar gyur cig ces so //
translated: The phrase in brief means may you be victorious.

original: bral ba'i sdug bsngal nyid khur chen po yin pas bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khur ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i sdug bsngal nyid khur chen po yin pas bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khur ro //
translated: The phrase the burden of the suffering of separation means that the suffering of separation itself is a great burden.

original: des gdungs pa'i snying gang yin pa de ni bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'o //üîΩyab gcig yum yang slad rol 'byung //
analyzed: des gdungs pa'i snying gang yin pa de ni bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'o // yab gcig yum yang slad rol 'byung //
translated: The phrase whose heart is tormented by the suffering of separation means that his heart is tormented by the suffering of separation.

original: khyod kyang bdag cag gtong bar bzhed //
analyzed: khyod kyang bdag cag gtong bar bzhed //
translated: The phrase Father, Mother, and you, too, means that he says to his parents, You, too, are giving me away.

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe ma slad rol du 'byung ba de'i tshe sbyin par bzhed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe ma slad rol du 'byung ba de'i tshe sbyin par bzhed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase when I go out means when I go out of the house.

original: sdug bsngal gyi myong ba ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi myong ba ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
translated: The phrase the experience of suffering means the experience of suffering.

original: de nyid dang por sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang po myong ba de'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang por sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang po myong ba de'o //
translated: That which first experiences suffering is the first experience of suffering.

original: de bas na skad phyung ste zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na skad phyung ste zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúcrying out‚Äù means with sound.

original: bram ze zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: bram ze zhes bstan pa la /
translated: The teacher is a brahmin.
